verses.name: Proverbs 29:1
verses.text: He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:2
verses.text: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:3
verses.text: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:4
verses.text: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:5
verses.text: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.

verses.name: Proverbs 29:6
verses.text: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
